text.text_translated: Much of today’s business happens across different countries, and although most people in the global business world use English as a common language, the details and expectations of communication can be very different from one culture to another. If we don’t understand the cultural customs and ways of working of the people we do business with, it can lead to unfair judgments, misunderstandings, and problems in communication. Business etiquette, which means the rules of polite behaviour, changes in many parts of the world. Here are three basic ways in which business etiquette differs around the world, and knowing these can help you when you work with someone from a different culture.
